content: face is lining up with where the ears are going to be sitting before you start sewing attach one ear to the end of the tape measurer that is sticking out the slit on the side by sticking it into the opening use the tail that was left from the ear and run it 4 through the stitches around the opening and tighten it a bit attach the other ear on the opposite side by sewing it on page 4 of 7 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together here i have all the parts lying out side by side in the second shot you can see i have embroidered the face using the instructions listed above you can also use google eyes like those below if you d prefer here i ve laid the pieces out next to each other so i can make sure i m sewing the face in the right position i wanted to make sure the tape was going to come out of his head where an ear would go i sewed the top or face to the bottom and sides by putting my needle through both loops of the stitch on the bottom piece and through one loop the one closest to the edge on the top piece this way it gives it an edge like the one you got on the bottom piece by working in the blo in row 6 page 5 of 7 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com here i ve sewn on the first ear by sticking the tape measurer end into the opening in the ear i used the tail from the ear piece and run it through the stitches around the opening and tightening the hole enough to make the ear fit snuggly but not enough to bunch up the tape then i just sewed the other ear opposite the first one to finish up page 6 of 7 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com here are some more pics of the finished tapester have fun page 7 of 7 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
